GOD.content: “who” can forgive, “what” can forgive? (who/what—impossible delimitation); Question of God: 1) can someone else forgive you? 2) can you forgive yourself?
GOD.linkedContent: “who” can forgive, “what” can forgive? (who/what—impossible delimitation); Question of God: 1) can someone else forgive you? 2) can you forgive yourself?

R.content: to think democracy [Paulhan], to think “first to happen by (le premier venue),” at limit of “who” or “what,” living being, cadaver > “first to happen by” = “first to come”?
R.linkedContent: to think democracy [Paulhan], to think “first to happen by (le premier venue),” at limit of “who” or “what,” living being, cadaver > “first to happen by” = “first to come”?

R.content: democracy opens public space by granting change of tone (Weschsel der Töne), irony as well as fiction, simulacrum, secret, literature > this undecidability [“I continue to believe”] only radical possibility of letting/thinking what comes about by arriving of whoever arrives [see p. 87]
R.linkedContent: democracy opens public space by granting change of tone (Weschsel der Töne), irony as well as fiction, simulacrum, secret, literature > this undecidability [“I continue to believe”] only radical possibility of letting/thinking what comes about by arriving of whoever arrives [see p. 87]

SPOM.content: “who” testifies to “what”? one never precedes the other
SPOM.linkedContent: “who” testifies to “what”? one never precedes the other

SPOM.content: event hesitates btwn “who” of the ghost and general “what” of the simulacrum
SPOM.linkedContent: event hesitates btwn “who” of the ghost and general “what” of the simulacrum

BL.content: who judges & according to what criteria
BL.linkedContent: who judges & according to what criteria

BL.content: to have rapport w/ law one must have no rapport w/ law, remain ignorant who/what it is
BL.linkedContent: to have rapport w/ law one must have no rapport w/ law, remain ignorant who/what it is

BL.content: knowing neither who nor what is the law: literature begins
BL.linkedContent: knowing neither who nor what is the law: literature begins

H.content: we let ourselves be interrogated by certain figures of the foreigner, “what?” “who?”
H.linkedContent: we let ourselves be interrogated by certain figures of the foreigner, “what?” “who?”

H.content: question of foreigner, question of response and responsibility
H.linkedContent: question of foreigner, question of response and responsibility

MPM.content: love, friendship, memory (moment two impossible promises are involved: “to what,” “to whom” are we destined) pledged beyond death, beyond what we call, without knowing what we speak, death; it involves, from the 1st moment, in reverse, the other is dead in us
MPM.linkedContent: love, friendship, memory (moment two impossible promises are involved: “to what,” “to whom” are we destined) pledged beyond death, beyond what we call, without knowing what we speak, death; it involves, from the 1st moment, in reverse, the other is dead in us

A.content: absolute arrivant: singularity of “who” arrives or neutrality of that which arrives
A.linkedContent: absolute arrivant: singularity of “who” arrives or neutrality of that which arrives

POOF.content: the question who or what is the friend? a protestation in name of the friend, in name of the name: resists reduction to dominant concept of political, ethical, ontophenomenological > a political allure that is not so political
POOF.linkedContent: the question who or what is the friend? a protestation in name of the friend, in name of the name: resists reduction to dominant concept of political, ethical, ontophenomenological > a political allure that is not so political

POOF.content: tís, who and what in Greek, why doesn’t this make Aristotle tremble?
POOF.linkedContent: tís, who and what in Greek, why doesn’t this make Aristotle tremble?

POOF.content: question “What is (tí estin) friendship?” & “Who is the friend (either sex)?” is nothing but the question “What is philosophy?”
POOF.linkedContent: question “What is (tí estin) friendship?” & “Who is the friend (either sex)?” is nothing but the question “What is philosophy?”

POOF.content: desire in lovence (friendship or love) engages me w/ a particular him or her, a singular ‘who,’ desire of the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance (nécessairement infranchissable), where a politics of lovence would no longer imply motifs of community, which always risks bringing a brother back > risk must still be assumed to keep question of ‘who’ from being politically enframed (arraisonner) by schema of l'être-commun
POOF.linkedContent: desire in lovence (friendship or love) engages me w/ a particular him or her, a singular ‘who,’ desire of the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance (nécessairement infranchissable), where a politics of lovence would no longer imply motifs of community, which always risks bringing a brother back > risk must still be assumed to keep question of ‘who’ from being politically enframed (arraisonner) by schema of l'être-commun

PAS.content: who is there? what can respond to viens? dislocated unity of as such, an affirmation that says yes not to a being but to what/who is to come again, there is no incompatibility, contradiction, but no dialectic, no reconciliation
PAS.linkedContent: who is there? what can respond to viens? dislocated unity of as such, an affirmation that says yes not to a being but to what/who is to come again, there is no incompatibility, contradiction, but no dialectic, no reconciliation

SH.content: date is a witness, but one can bless date w/out knowing to “what” or for “whom” one bears witness, always possible there’ll no longer be a witness for this witness
SH.linkedContent: date is a witness, but one can bless date w/out knowing to “what” or for “whom” one bears witness, always possible there’ll no longer be a witness for this witness

FWT.content: absolute hospitality, risk, exposure to “who” comes, when love arrives > must maintain concept of this horizon w/out horizon, it can’t become a political/juridical concept
FWT.linkedContent: absolute hospitality, risk, exposure to “who” comes, when love arrives > must maintain concept of this horizon w/out horizon, it can’t become a political/juridical concept

ATIA.content: suis of Qui/Que suis-je? (both être and suivre) the little third party as copula, comes btwn subject and itself, worries it (s’acharne), hounds it, to hunt itself in the mirror
ATIA.linkedContent: suis of Qui/Que suis-je? (both être and suivre) the little third party as copula, comes btwn subject and itself, worries it (s’acharne), hounds it, to hunt itself in the mirror

SW.content: “for they shall make a sanctuary, I shall dwell in their bosom” > veil, curtain, drape is dwelling of God, his ethos, this Who (that dwells) is also a What, a 3rd party, the Law, text of law
SW.linkedContent: “for they shall make a sanctuary, I shall dwell in their bosom” > veil, curtain, drape is dwelling of God, his ethos, this Who (that dwells) is also a What, a 3rd party, the Law, text of law

PF.content: concept w/out concept of resistance, brought in line (after twists/turns) w/ desistance, especially restance (restance in Glas: being “nothing,” w/out substance, upsets ontological question “What is it?”—older than distinction btwn “who” and “what”)
PF.linkedContent: concept w/out concept of resistance, brought in line (after twists/turns) w/ desistance, especially restance (restance in Glas: being “nothing,” w/out substance, upsets ontological question “What is it?”—older than distinction btwn “who” and “what”)

TR.content: Rousseau’s “I was as if,” the theft of the “I”:  one cannot steal a “what” w/out stealing, even raping, a “who,” a woman, child, man
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s “I was as if,” the theft of the “I”: one cannot steal a “what” w/out stealing, even raping, a “who,” a woman, child, man

PSSS.content: the who and the what of what arrives, the arrivant, the event, makes outdated in advance the question about it that always comes too late
PSSS.linkedContent: the who and the what of what arrives, the arrivant, the event, makes outdated in advance the question about it that always comes too late

HST.content: grave substitution (one worthy of name), life for another, or life for something (contaminate logic of who w/ what, ethics w/ arithmetic, arithméthique) > (fetishism is only a figure of this)
HST.linkedContent: grave substitution (one worthy of name), life for another, or life for something (contaminate logic of who w/ what, ethics w/ arithmetic, arithméthique) > (fetishism is only a figure of this)

HST.content: Derrida using logic of substitution to complicate “what,” thing, “who,” person > “one +”—its substitute can always be what one calls a “what”
HST.linkedContent: Derrida using logic of substitution to complicate “what,” thing, “who,” person > “one +”—its substitute can always be what one calls a “what”

TN.content: touch who, touch what, coup, caress, biting kiss
the who of the touch not necessarily human or male
TN.linkedContent: the who of the touch not necessarily human or male

TN.content: touching-power (pouvoir le toucher): 1) force of power, free, sovereign, potency 2) reserved virtuality, dunamis, capability
TN.linkedContent: touching-power (pouvoir le toucher): 1) force of power, free, sovereign, potency 2) reserved virtuality, dunamis, capability

TN.content: touching has potential or power to touch personal pronoun “who” and definite article “what”
TN.linkedContent: touching has potential or power to touch personal pronoun “who” and definite article “what”

TN.content: Redlichkeit (probity), exact can be a virtue (who to whom), not just objective (what)
TN.linkedContent: Redlichkeit (probity), exact can be a virtue (who to whom), not just objective (what)

TN.content: greatest risk, try to know to “whom,” not about “what,” you’re talking
TN.linkedContent: greatest risk, try to know to “whom,” not about “what,” you’re talking

EW.content: Derrida’s “subject”: a place or non-place in a text, an instance (w/out stance) for some “who,” a “who” besieged by problematic of trace and differance, of the je[c]t as destinerring of missive
EW.linkedContent: Derrida’s “subject”: a place or non-place in a text, an instance (w/out stance) for some “who,” a “who” besieged by problematic of trace and differance, of the je[c]t as destinerring of missive

EW.content: not necessary that singularity be translated by “who” or remain privilege of “who”
EW.linkedContent: not necessary that singularity be translated by “who” or remain privilege of “who”

EW.content: Heidegger and Nietzsche, in spite of their distrust for substantialist or subjectivist metaphysics, endorsed the “who,” subtracted “who” from deconstruction of subject
EW.linkedContent: Heidegger and Nietzsche, in spite of their distrust for substantialist or subjectivist metaphysics, endorsed the “who,” subtracted “who” from deconstruction of subject

EW.content: link the question of “who” to the question of “sacrifice,” phallogocentrism as a schema of carnivorous virility
EW.linkedContent: link the question of “who” to the question of “sacrifice,” phallogocentrism as a schema of carnivorous virility

EW.content: Derrida links denegation of murder, in the putting to death of the animal, to the violent institution of the “who” as subject
EW.linkedContent: Derrida links denegation of murder, in the putting to death of the animal, to the violent institution of the “who” as subject

CF.content: “who,” “what,” do you forgive? from “whom,” for “what,” do you ask forgiveness?
CF.linkedContent: “who,” “what,” do you forgive? from “whom,” for “what,” do you ask forgiveness?

BSi.content: “who” and “what” sink into indifference, into the abyss of who-becoming-what (death)—becoming what we will have always been
BSi.linkedContent: “who” and “what” sink into indifference, into the abyss of who-becoming-what (death)—becoming what we will have always been

BSi.content: talk of the bottom (fond), the profound, believing in depth [of “who” or “what”] will never be free from bêtise (stupidity) > sovereign & beast as bottomless bottom, abyss, vertigo
BSi.linkedContent: talk of the bottom (fond), the profound, believing in depth [of “who” or “what”] will never be free from bêtise (stupidity) > sovereign & beast as bottomless bottom, abyss, vertigo

BSi.content: bêtise as becoming “what” of “who”—monument, stone, becoming-thing of proper name
BSi.linkedContent: bêtise as becoming “what” of “who”—monument, stone, becoming-thing of proper name

BSi.content: force-differential (unconscious mechanisms) btwn which tension/contradiction bound to localize > bêtise on both sides: side of sovereign (who), side of beast, the stupid, the other (what)
BSi.linkedContent: force-differential (unconscious mechanisms) btwn which tension/contradiction bound to localize > bêtise on both sides: side of sovereign (who), side of beast, the stupid, the other (what)

BSi.content: [feminine?] marionette: btwn who/what, sensible/insensible—tekhnē btwn art & technique, btwn life & politics
BSi.linkedContent: [feminine?] marionette: btwn who/what, sensible/insensible—tekhnē btwn art & technique, btwn life & politics

BSi.content: in Monsieur Teste, a Nietzschean kind of superman, infinitely cunning and infinitely bête solitary types: incalculable/hyperbolic arithmetic turns “who” into “what”
BSi.linkedContent: in Monsieur Teste, a Nietzschean kind of superman, infinitely cunning and infinitely bête solitary types: incalculable/hyperbolic arithmetic turns “who” into “what”

BSi.content: [via Celan via Büchner’s Danton’s Death] art as species of marionette > marionette: an allegorical personification of technē, technical who and what
BSi.linkedContent: [via Celan via Büchner’s Danton’s Death] art as species of marionette > marionette: an allegorical personification of technē, technical who and what

BSi.content: for Heidegger, in the questioning essence of man, man comes to himself as “who” not “what” (ipseity [Selbst] before any “I,” individual, we or community)
BSi.linkedContent: for Heidegger, in the questioning essence of man, man comes to himself as “who” not “what” (ipseity [Selbst] before any “I,” individual, we or community)

BSi.content: an autopsy [the seminar too?], the becoming-what of the who? ——response to questions “so what, so who?” meant to enrich my science, knowledge, conscience through onto-logy, theatrical theorein (optical gaze) > sovereign autopsy
BSi.linkedContent: an autopsy [the seminar too?], the becoming-what of the who? ——response to questions “so what, so who?” meant to enrich my science, knowledge, conscience through onto-logy, theatrical theorein (optical gaze) > sovereign autopsy

OG.content: [early who/what] sacrifice the I am present for what I am, what I’m worth: renounce my present life to achieve myself in ideality/truth > writing is the phenomenon of this battle (replaces presence by value)
OG.linkedContent: [early who/what] sacrifice the I am present for what I am, what I’m worth: renounce my present life to achieve myself in ideality/truth > writing is the phenomenon of this battle (replaces presence by value)

CIR.content: foreskin & truth (detour/delay): question of knowing by whom by what the violence of circumcision was imposed
CIR.linkedContent: foreskin & truth (detour/delay): question of knowing by whom by what the violence of circumcision was imposed
